title: Need help from a Rioter on ping problems
body:
Short version of this is I play on both LAN and NA and my ping on LAN has been extremely high compared to what it should be.

Regular NA ping > 60~ - current NA ping > 60~

Regular LAN ping > 38~ - current LAN ping > 70~

I only get ping problems on LAN and I have no idea what's causing it.

I haven't moved, my internet provider hasn't changed. I haven't changed anything that could make it go up by 30 and stay in that spot permanently.

It has been going on for about 2+ weeks and the ticket I sent about it was useless to say the least. I submitted network info and a netalyzer in the initial ticket, the first reply asked for a netalyzer so I sent it again to make sure they received it and the reply after that once again asked me to do a netalyzer, so I just gave up and stopped responding.

As of right now after I just restarted my router, my ping on all servers has gone up by 30 once again and my LAN ping is currently sitting at a consistent 100.
Being that I play in challenger my ping being over double what I'm used to is extremely hindering and I would appreciate if someone could help me resolve it quickly so I can get back to playing.

replies.body: You could have a degrading connection to the game server, but your ISP may have also changed how you're routing there too.  To start off, go over the steps in our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to help troubleshoot.  Test it in a custom game to see if the steps worked.  Let me know if you have any questions!

To start off, go over the steps in our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to help troubleshoot.  Test it in a custom game to see if the steps worked.  Let me know if you have any questions!

I went through the steps and got no improvement at all, all of those troubleshooting steps seem to be geared towards disconnections which I'm not having.

I've had higher ping consistently, I had 35-40 last season when I played and this season it has not gone below 63.

I think you're right in that it must be the routing, when I ping the LAN server IP it returns with around a 40 ms response time which isn't far from what my ping used to be, but when I actually get in game it becomes 64-70.

Is there a way to force an optimal route?

For sure, the configuring dns steps in the guide might be able to adjust your routing.  Otherwise, you would need to contact your ISP and help them point areas where their nodes might be starting to degrade.  We don't offer LAN region support here, so I actually don't know the specific IP you'd want to run for a traceroute.  You may want to seek out LAN support if you have an account there.

I set my DNS to 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4 as the guide showed and got no improvement to my ping. I contacted LAN support a few days ago and they just repeatedly asked me for a network analysis after I gave it to them 3 times so I just looked for help elsewhere.
